bibliographic_metadata.Title: Optimized AI-MPM: Application of PSO for tuning the hyperparameters of SVM and RF algorithms
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Mehrdad Daviran, Abbas Maghsoudi, Reza Ghezelbash

abstract: This study introduces a hybrid model combining Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) with Support Vector Machines (SVM) and Random Forest (RF) algorithms for mineral prospectivity mapping. The PSO algorithm fine-tunes hyperparameters, enhancing prediction accuracy for porphyry-type Cu mineralization in the Kerman belt, SE Iran. The model integrates diverse datasets and evaluates performance using multiple validation methods, demonstrating superior accuracy in identifying mineral-rich zones.
methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > kernel-based > support vector machine; optimization/heuristic > metaheuristics > particle swarm optimization

types: Geochemical signatures in stream sediments; Unknown

key_points: The PSO-SVM model outperformed traditional models in identifying mineral-rich zones.
Integration of diverse datasets significantly enhances predictive accuracy.
The study area is characterized by Eocene volcano-sedimentary rocks associated with porphyry copper deposits.
Hyperparameter tuning using PSO improves model performance and reduces uncertainty.
